published_paper_abstract: AMS 14C analysis of a fishhook preform recovered from the lowest stratum of the rock shelter returned a date of 8380 ± 50 RCYBP (Beta-236254), or 8750–8500 cal BP, with a reservoir effect of 250 ± 20 years, making this artifact one of the earliest known examples of a shell fishhook in the world.
published_paper_venue: Monographs of the Western North American Naturalist

published_paper_abstract: Mind wandering was defined both behaviorally, indicated by a failure to withhold a response to a target, and subjectively, via self-report at a thought probe.

title: This Study Has Good News For People Who Spend All Their Time Daydreaming

published_paper_title: Going AWOL in the Brain: Mind Wandering Reduces Cortical Analysis of External Events
published_paper_authors: Jonathan Smallwood, Emily Beach, Jonathan W. Schooler, Todd C. Handy
published_paper_abstract: The P300 event-related potential component for nontargets was reduced prior to both the behavioral and subjective reports of mind wandering, relative to periods of being “on-task.” Regression analysis of P300 amplitude revealed significant common variance between behavioral and subjective markers of mind wandering, suggesting that both markers reflect a common underlying mental state.

title: This Study Has Good News For People Who Spend All Their Time Daydreaming

published_paper_abstract: Finally, control analysis revealed that the effect of mind wandering on the P300 could not be ascribed to changes in motor activity nor was it associated with general arousal.

published_paper_abstract: Our data suggest that when trying to engage attention in a sustained manner, the mind will naturally ebb and flow in the depth of cognitive analysis it applies to events in the external environment.
